requirement_tested: A frontend application that fetches all dynamic data from backend APIs
user_persona: A curious visitor exploring creative works on the World of Imagination website.
user_goal: Browse a list of user-created imaginative works fetched dynamically from the backend.

narrative_steps.title: Visiting the Homepage
narrative_steps.description: Sarah opens her browser and visits the 'World of Imagination' homepage to explore creative content.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the homepage URL.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The page loads with a grid-based layout displaying cards of creative works fetched from the backend API.

narrative_steps.title: Scrolling for More Content
narrative_steps.description: As Sarah scrolls down the page, she expects to see more content loaded automatically without needing to click anything.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll down the page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Additional content cards load seamlessly as the scroll reaches the bottom, simulating infinite scrolling behavior.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Details of a Creative Work
narrative_steps.description: Sarah finds an interesting artwork and decides to click on its card to view detailed information about it.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a content card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: She is redirected to the detailed view page for that specific creative work.

requirement_tested: A backend API server that connects to a PostgreSQL database using specified environment variables
user_persona: A developer setting up the backend server for deployment.
user_goal: Verify that the backend successfully connects to the PostgreSQL database using predefined environment variables.

narrative_steps.title: Starting the Backend Server
narrative_steps.description: Alex runs the backend server locally to ensure it initializes properly and connects to the database.
narrative_steps.action: Start the backend server process.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Server logs indicate successful connection to the PostgreSQL database using the environment variables: DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, DB_USERNAME=myappuser, DB_PASSWORD=myapppassword, DB_NAME=myapp.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Database Content
narrative_steps.description: Alex makes a GET request to the '/api/v1/contents' endpoint to confirm data can be retrieved from the connected database.
narrative_steps.action: Send a GET request to '/api/v1/contents'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The API responds with a list of creative works retrieved from the 'contents' table in the PostgreSQL database.

requirement_tested: User authentication and session management system
user_persona: A returning member wanting to log into their account.
user_goal: Log in securely and maintain session state across the site.

narrative_steps.title: Navigating to Login Page
narrative_steps.description: Jamie clicks on the 'Login' link located at the top right corner of the homepage.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Login' link.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A login form with email and password fields appears.

narrative_steps.title: Entering Credentials
narrative_steps.description: Jamie enters valid login credentials into the form fields.
narrative_steps.action: Fill in email and password fields, then click 'Submit'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Upon successful validation, an HTTP-only cookie is set containing the session identifier.

narrative_steps.title: Logging Out
narrative_steps.description: After browsing, Jamie clicks the logout option in the user dropdown menu.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Logout' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Session is invalidated server-side, the cookie is deleted, and Jamie is redirected to the homepage in an unauthenticated state.

requirement_tested: Content browsing interface to view user-created imaginative works
user_persona: An art enthusiast looking for inspiration.
user_goal: Explore and view imaginative artworks submitted by users.

narrative_steps.title: Landing on the Browse Page
narrative_steps.description: Taylor visits the main content browsing section to look at imaginative creations.
narrative_steps.action: Load the content browsing page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A responsive grid of content cards is displayed, each showing thumbnail image, title, excerpt, author name, and creation date.

narrative_steps.title: Clicking on a Content Card
narrative_steps.description: Taylor clicks on one of the content cards to see the full details of the creative work.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a content card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Redirected to the detailed view page of the selected creative work.

requirement_tested: Share Ideas form for users to submit their creative concepts
user_persona: An artist ready to share their latest idea.
user_goal: Submit a new creative concept via the Share Ideas form.

narrative_steps.title: Opening the Share Ideas Form
narrative_steps.description: Morgan, a registered user, clicks the 'Share Idea' button to begin submitting a new creative concept.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Share Idea' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A modal or dedicated page opens with a form containing Title, Description, and Media Upload fields.

narrative_steps.title: Uploading a File
narrative_steps.description: Morgan selects an image file to upload along with the idea.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Choose File' button and select a file from the OS file picker.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Selected filename appears next to the upload button.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting the Form
narrative_steps.description: After filling out the form, Morgan clicks the Submit button.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Submit' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Form data is sent to the backend API, and Morgan is redirected to the newly created content detail page upon success.

requirement_tested: Discussion forum or comment section for each creative work
user_persona: A community participant interested in engaging with creators.
user_goal: Leave feedback and reply to comments under a creative work.

narrative_steps.title: Reading Existing Comments
narrative_steps.description: Jordan views the discussion thread beneath a creative piece.
narrative_steps.action: Load the content detail page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A threaded comment section appears below the content, showing previous comments with avatars, usernames, and timestamps.

narrative_steps.title: Replying to a Comment
narrative_steps.description: Jordan wants to respond directly to another user's comment.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Reply' button under a specific comment.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: An inline textarea and submit button appear beneath the comment.

narrative_steps.title: Posting the Reply
narrative_steps.description: Jordan writes their response and submits it.
narrative_steps.action: Type into the reply textarea and click the 'Submit' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The reply is added immediately to the comment thread without reloading the entire page.

requirement_tested: User interaction features including likes, comments, and follows
user_persona: A regular user engaging with the platform’s social features.
user_goal: Like a post, follow an author, and leave a comment.

narrative_steps.title: Liking a Post
narrative_steps.description: Casey sees an inspiring artwork and decides to like it.
narrative_steps.action: Click the heart icon (Like button) associated with a content card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The heart icon changes color indicating the post has been liked, and the like counter increments.

narrative_steps.title: Following the Author
narrative_steps.description: Impressed by the creator's work, Casey chooses to follow them.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Follow' button near the author's name.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Button label changes to 'Unfollow', and the backend records the follow relationship.

narrative_steps.title: Commenting on the Post
narrative_steps.description: Casey leaves a thoughtful comment about the creative work.
narrative_steps.action: Click the speech bubble icon to open the comment input, type a message, and submit.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The comment appears instantly in the discussion section below the post.

requirement_tested: User profile pages displaying shared content and activity
user_persona: A content creator checking their personal contributions.
user_goal: Review their shared works and recent activities on their profile page.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Profile Page
narrative_steps.description: Riley navigates to their own profile page to review their published content.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the profile avatar in the header and select 'My Profile'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The profile page loads, displaying Riley's avatar, bio, and statistics such as number of posts, followers, and following.

narrative_steps.title: Switching Tabs
narrative_steps.description: Riley wants to see only the works they've shared recently.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Shared Works' tab.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The content grid updates dynamically to show only Riley’s shared creative works.

requirement_tested: Search and filtering capabilities for browsing content
user_persona: Someone seeking specific types of imaginative content.
user_goal: Find content related to a keyword and sort it by popularity.

narrative_steps.title: Searching for Content
narrative_steps.description: Dana uses the search bar to find content related to 'fantasy landscapes'.
narrative_steps.action: Type 'fantasy landscapes' into the search bar and press Enter.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Results matching the query populate the content grid below.

narrative_steps.title: Applying Sorting Filter
narrative_steps.description: Dana prefers to see the most popular items first.
narrative_steps.action: Select 'Most Popular' from the sort dropdown menu.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The content grid refreshes with results sorted by popularity.

requirement_tested: Responsive web design compatible with desktop and mobile devices
user_persona: A frequent mobile user accessing the site on the go.
user_goal: Use the website smoothly on both mobile and desktop screens.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Site on Mobile Device
narrative_steps.description: Elliot opens the website on his smartphone to browse content.
narrative_steps.action: Visit the website on a mobile device.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Layout adjusts appropriately—cards stack vertically, navigation collapses into a hamburger menu, and touch targets are sufficiently large.

narrative_steps.title: Rotating Screen Orientation
narrative_steps.description: Elliot rotates his phone from portrait to landscape mode.
narrative_steps.action: Rotate the device screen.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: UI adapts fluidly to the new orientation, maintaining readability and usability.

requirement_tested: Dark slate blue color scheme applied to all UI components
user_persona: A designer reviewing the visual consistency of the site.
user_goal: Confirm that all interactive components use the correct dark slate blue theme.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Component Colors
narrative_steps.description: Zoe inspects various UI elements like buttons, cards, and headers to verify consistent color usage.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate through multiple pages and inspect component styles.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All component containers consistently use Dark Slate Blue (#483D8B) as the primary color against the Azure Mist background.

requirement_tested: Azure mist background theme implemented across all pages
user_persona: A UI reviewer validating brand consistency.
user_goal: Ensure that every page maintains the Azure Mist background theme.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Background Consistency
narrative_steps.description: Max navigates through several sections of the website to check if the background remains consistent.
narrative_steps.action: Visit different pages like Home, Profile, Search, and Detail View.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Each page displays the Azure Mist (#E0F7FA) background uniformly.

requirement_tested: Repository package.json configured with install:all and dev scripts
user_persona: A developer setting up the project for development.
user_goal: Install dependencies and start both frontend and backend servers simultaneously.

narrative_steps.title: Installing Dependencies
narrative_steps.description: Sam clones the repository and needs to install all frontend and backend dependencies quickly.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run install:all` command in terminal.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both frontend and backend dependencies are installed successfully.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Development Servers
narrative_steps.description: Sam wants to launch both frontend and backend services together.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run dev` command.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Frontend and backend servers start concurrently, allowing seamless development workflow.

requirement_tested: Database schema supporting users, content, discussions, and interactions
user_persona: A database administrator setting up the production schema.
user_goal: Ensure all necessary tables and relationships exist in the PostgreSQL database.

narrative_steps.title: Verifying Table Creation
narrative_steps.description: Devon checks whether the required tables have been created according to the schema specification.
narrative_steps.action: Query the PostgreSQL database to list existing tables.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Tables named 'users', 'contents', 'discussions', 'likes', 'follows', and 'sessions' are present.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Foreign Key Relationships
narrative_steps.description: Devon verifies that foreign key constraints are enforced among tables.
narrative_steps.action: Examine table schemas to identify foreign key references.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Foreign key relationships like author_id referencing users.id are correctly defined.

requirement_tested: API endpoints for content creation, retrieval, updating, and deletion
user_persona: A frontend engineer integrating CRUD operations with the backend.
user_goal: Successfully call standard RESTful endpoints for managing content resources.

narrative_steps.title: Creating New Content
narrative_steps.description: Taylor sends a POST request to add a new creative work to the database.
narrative_steps.action: Make a POST request to '/api/v1/contents' with valid payload.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: New content is inserted into the 'contents' table and returned with a generated ID.

narrative_steps.title: Retrieving Specific Content
narrative_steps.description: Taylor retrieves the previously created content by ID.
narrative_steps.action: Make a GET request to '/api/v1/contents/{id}'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Returns the full details of the requested content item.

narrative_steps.title: Updating Content
narrative_steps.description: Taylor edits the description of the content and updates it.
narrative_steps.action: Make a PUT request to '/api/v1/contents/{id}' with updated data.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The content record is updated in the database and reflects the new values.

narrative_steps.title: Deleting Content
narrative_steps.description: Finally, Taylor removes the content from the database.
narrative_steps.action: Make a DELETE request to '/api/v1/contents/{id}'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The content record is removed from the 'contents' table.
